attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokemon attacks Pikachu during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokemon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Light Screen
attacks.text: Whenever an attack does damage to Electabuzz (after applying Weakness and Resistance) during your opponent's next turn, that attack only does half the damage to Electabuzz (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Mewtwo.

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Pikachu. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu in order to use this attack.

abilities.name: Special Delivery
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. If you do, choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Dragonite is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic Flight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Flames of Rage
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Arcanine.

attacks.name: First Aid
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Jigglypuff.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Jigglypuff does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attacks.name: Devolution Beam
attacks.text: Choose an evolved Pokemon (your own or your opponent's). Return the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokemon to its player's hand. That Pokemon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attacks.name: Devolution Beam
attacks.text: Choose an evolved Pokemon (your own or your opponent's). Return the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokemon to its player's hand. That Pokemon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

attacks.name: Cat Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage. If tails and if your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

abilities.name: Chain Reaction
abilities.text: This power can only be used when a Pokemon evolves. Search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee and attach it to Eevee. This counts as evolving Eevee. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Eevee is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Control
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon and attach it to another of your opponent's Pokemon of your choice.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

abilities.name: Solar Power
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Your Active Pokemon and the Defending Pokemon are no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venusaur equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Venusaur has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Mewtwo.

attacks.name: Texture Magic
attacks.text: You may change Cool Porygon's Resistance to a type of your choice other than Colorless. If the Defending Pokemon has a Weakness, you may change it to a type of your choice other than Colorless. (Benching either Pokemon ends the effect on that Pokemon.)

attacks.name: 3-D Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Computer Error
rules: You may draw up to 5 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 5 cards. Your turn is over now (you don't get to attack).

attacks.name: Tempt
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon and switch it with the Defending Pokemon.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. if heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Miraculous Comeback
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Pokemon in play. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. Then Team Rocket's Meowth does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

attacks.name: Synchronize
attacks.text: This attack can't be used unless Sabrina's Abra and the Defending Pokemon have the same number of Energy cards attached to them.

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hyper Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Moltres. If tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Moltres. If you can't discard Energy cards, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Diamond Dust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attacks.name: Lightning Burn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Birthday Surprise
attacks.text: If it's not your birthday, this attack does 30 damage. If it is your birthday, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Flying Pikachu; if tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Pikachu.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Marill but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Snivel
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokemon attacks Togepi during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Togepi is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokemon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokemon is, Togepi's type is still Colorless.) Togepi performs that attack.

name: Cleffa
rules: If this Baby Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Eek
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Paint
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a type (other than Colorless) and put a Coloring counter on the Defending Pokemon. That Pokemon is now the type you chose. If it already had a Coloring counter, remove the old one. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack Scizor during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokemon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Metal Pincer
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Bolt
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Entei, unless that attack Knocks Out Entei, flip a coin. If heads, shuffle Entei and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power can't be used if Entei is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when it is damaged.

attacks.name: Protective Flame
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to your Benched Pokemon.

name: Pichu
rules: If this Baby Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Let's Play!
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Baby Pokemon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

name: Igglybuff
rules: If this Baby Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Good Night Song
attacks.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Repeating Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokemon, then, if you have any Benched Pokemon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokemon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)

name: Unown [J]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokemon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Join]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [J], Unown [O], Unown [I], and Unown Dragon on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokemon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Pain Split
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokemon for each damage counter on Misdreavus.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Pokemon Center
rules: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokemon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokemon.

name: Lucky Stadium
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Once during each player's turn (before attacking), that player may flip a coin. If heads, that player draws a card.

name: Pokemon Tower
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
If the effect of a Pokemon Power, attack, Energy card, or Trainer card would put a card in a discard pile into its owner's hand, that card stays in that discard pile instead.

attacks.name: Seething Anger
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on Machamp. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokemon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)

attacks.name: Burning Fire
attacks.text: When you use this attack, you may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to your Pokemon in play. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: Scyther can't use this attack during your next turn. (Benching or evolving Scyther ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Lightning Rod
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon and put a Lightning Rod marker on it. (A Pokemon can have only 1 Lightning Rod marker on it at a time.)

attacks.name: Lightning Bolt
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to any Pokemon with a Lightning Rod marker on it. Apply Weakness and Resistance.

abilities.name: Neutral Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mew by Evolved Pokemon. You can't use this power if Mew is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Aurora Veil
abilities.text: As long as Articuno is your Active Pokemon, your Benched Pokemon do not take damage from and are not affected by attacks. This power cannot be used if Articuno is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Guard
abilities.text: As long as Snorlax is your Active Pokemon, the Defending Pokemon can't Retreat. This power stops working when Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Roll Over
attacks.text: Snorlax is now Asleep. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leaf Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Jump Over
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Sacred Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 60.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Suicune, you must discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (Attach the Water Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Suicune.)

attacks.name: Hypno Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
